glsa.title: Perl: Multiple vulnerabilities
glsa.synopsis: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in Perl, the worst of which could allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary code.

background.p: Perl is a highly capable, feature-rich programming language.

description.p: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in Perl. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below for details.

impact.p: A remote attacker could possibly execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the process, cause a Denial of Service condition, or escalate privileges.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All Perl users should upgrade to the latest version:

Warning: When you are upgrading to a new major Perl version, the commands above may not be sufficient. Please visit the Gentoo wiki referenced below to learn how to upgrade to a new major Perl version.

references.uri: Gentoo Wiki: How to upgrade Perl
